<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Push a Ctrl-E and a tab. The Ctrl-E causes libedit to move the cursor</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// to the end of the line, so that when we emit a newline we will be on</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// a new blank line. The tab causes libedit to call this function again</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// after moving the cursor. There doesn&#39;t seem to be anything we can do</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// from here to cause libedit to move the cursor immediately. This will</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// break horribly if the user has rebound their keys, so for now we do</span></CodeLine>
